bug.author: josephhaaga
bug.description:
Please make sure that this is a documentation issue. As per our GitHub Policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests and build/installation issues on GitHub. tag:doc_template System information
TensorFlow version: 2.0 Doc Link: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/math/add
Describe the documentation issue Much like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/25802>#25802</denchmark-link> , documentation for is created from a generated file ; a link to the file that generates would be handy for users. tf.math.add could use a usage example, and a list of Errors raised. We welcome contributions by users. Will you be able to update submit a PR (use the doc style guide) to fix the doc Issue? Yes

comments.comment: Hey beginner here, On which branch can I find tf v2.0 ? cause it seems to end with 1.99

@Sangarshanan you can download from here
Yes that's the pip package. The package is built from with a 2.0 config flag... I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dynamicwebpaige>@dynamicwebpaige</denchmark-link> knows the exact commands. Paige is someone working on a install/source page for the tf2 docs?
a link to the file that generates python/ops/gen_math_ops.py would be handy for users.
Yes! I believe it's <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/ops/math_ops.cc#L409>this file</denchmark-link> , but I can't think of a way to find this by introspection while generating the docs. Anyone have ideas? ( I usually find them by searching for quotes from the tf.org page )
tf.math.add could use a usage example, and a list of Errors raised.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/josephhaaga>@josephhaaga</denchmark-link> can you send a PR?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkDaoust>@MarkDaoust</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Sangarshanan>@Sangarshanan</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/josephhaaga>@josephhaaga</denchmark-link>
You can build TF 2.0 from source with: <denchmark-code>export TF_NEED_CUDA=0 cd tensorflow yes "" | ./configure
bazel build --config=opt --config=v2 tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package mkdir pip_pkg ./bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package pip_pkg --nightly_flag \ --project_name tf_nightly_2.0_preview
</denchmark-code>
I do not think that anyone is working on adding installation from source to the docs - but that would be a great add! So would the guide to modifying gen_math_ops.py documentation. ðŸ˜„ Thanks for your interest in improving the TF 2.0 API docs! We appreciate it.
I believe this could be closed due to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/33773>#33773</denchmark-link>
